items.message: This flood alert remains in place. Areas most at risk include low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. Heavy rainfall is forecast for tonight into Tuesday 09 December 2025. River levels are now steady but are forecast to rise overnight and tomorrow. We are closely monitoring the situation and will update this message by 11:30AM on 09 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message: Areas most at risk are Church Laneham to Rampton Road. Further rainfall is forecast over tonight into Tuesday morning. River levels at Torksey Gauge are rising with this mornings tide at 10:45 and later this evening at 23:00. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 08 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road. Further rainfall is forecast Monday night into Tuesday morning, 09/12/2025. River levels at Pillings Lock gauge are falling but remain above the flood risk threshold, forecast rainfall could cause a further rise in levels. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 08 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message:
High river levels may lead to flooding.

Flooding is possible from the morning of the 08 Dec 2025.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible today, along the River Churn around Cerney Wick. The weather forecast is for further rain over the next two days which could be heavy at times. We expect river levels to remain high.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 19:00 on 08 Dec 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
High river levels may lead to flooding.

Flooding is possible from the morning of the 08 Dec 2025.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible today, 08 Dec 2025, along the River Thames, especially in the Kempsford area. This is as a result of rivers responding to recent rainfall. The weather forecast is for further rain over the next two days which could be heavy at times. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 19:00 on 08 Dec 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message: River levels downstream on the River Yeo, and on the Rivers Cam and Wriggle, have fallen but the level remains high at Sherborne Lake, which is still above the Alert level. A band of heavy persistent rain is forecast from this evening, Monday 08 December 2025, through to about midday tomorrow, which will cause flooding impacts and sustain this Alert. Other rivers in the area, including the Rivers Yeo, Cam and Wriggle, are forecast to rise. Flooding of low-lying land and roads is is likely in this area, including around the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole.  We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary. We are checking defences and clearing bridges, culverts and screens where necessary. Continue to take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Keep checking for updates to these Alerts. This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high due to recent rainfall. Further rainfall is forecast and the risk of flooding continues. Flooding is possible on 08 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Wolverley to Newport. Other locations that may be affected include Market Drayton, Wem, and Rodington. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes

items.description: Upper Avon River Swift and Clay Coton Brook
items.message:
River levels remain high today and may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 04 December 2025
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 11:30AM on 06 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Forecast high river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 09 December 2025 due to heavy rainfall this evening and overnight. 
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Upper Dorset Frome, Hooke River, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Toller Whelme and Dorchester.  Flooding is possible from 3am as river levels are expected to rise rapidly after intense rainfall this evening and into the early hours of Tuesday. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and checking rivers for blockages. 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have and monitor local water levels and weather conditions. 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high at the Stinsford river gauge on the Lower Frome after recent rainfall. Flooding is forecast to affect low lying areas to start with near to the River Frome in the Dorchester, West Stafford, Bockhampton, Lewell, Tincleton, Pallington, Waddock, Moreton, Wool, East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham areas. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this Flood Alert if necessary. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. People in this area should take action now and watch your local weather forecast. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 9 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high due to recent rainfall. Flooding is possible today 07 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Mole and its tributaries from Kinnersley Manor to South Hersham
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message: The Yeo and Parrett rivers are still high, sustained by the high flows following the weekend's rain. A band of heavy persistent rain is forecast from this evening, Monday 08/12/2025, through to about midday tomorrow, which will cause further flooding impacts and sustain this Alert. The rain will cause rivers to rise again and bring fresh flows down into the Moors. Drier weather is forecast on Wednesday and Thursday. The current river level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 8.14m and falling. The current drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 6.99m and falling slowly. Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if this level exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; the road from Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and the road from Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. We are pumping when river levels allow. Avoid driving through flood water. Refer to the local authority website for any local road closures. This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bath and North East Somerset, Wiltshire

items.message: This flood alert remains in place. Areas most at risk include low lying land and roads between Melksham and Bathford. The flood gates at Holt Road may be closed. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Semington Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. Heavy rainfall is forecast for tonight into Tuesday 09 December 2025. River levels are now steady but are forecast to rise overnight and tomorrow. We are closely monitoring the situation and will update this message by 11:30AM on 09 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

River levels remain higher than normal in Hellingly and Alfriston. River levels in Hellingly will fall through Monday morning. In Alfriston river levels will not begin to fall until mid afternoon Monday. Light rain is forecast Monday afternoon. River levels along the whole Cuckmere are forecast to rise a minimal amount. More rain in the early hours of Tuesday will cause river levels to rise higher. Eventually beginning to fall in Hellingly Tuesday afternoon, and in Alfriston Wednesday morning. River levels are not currently expected to rise higher than they have been in recent days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Don't put yourself or others at risk. Avoid roads that flood (Mill Lane and Church Road Hellingly, North Street Alfriston). This message will be updated by 21:00 on 08/12/2025.

Forecast rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 09 December 2025 . 
Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to Wymans Brook, Carrant Brook, Hatherley Brook, Swilgate and the River Chelt. Locations that may be affected include Mitton, Ashchurch, Walton Cardiff and locations along the River Chelt from Charlton Kings to Uckington and Boddington. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are still high in Fittleworth and near Selham, but falling in all communities. Minor flood impacts affecting fields and gardens near Fittleworth Mill will continue. Light rain is forecast Monday afternoon. Only a minimal amount of river rise is expected. However, more rain in the early hours of Tuesday could cause river levels to rise higher. Eventually beginning to fall in Liss on Tuesday afternoon, but not until Wednesday afternoon near Fittleworth. If the higher amounts of forecast rain occur, at Lodsbridge near Selham and Fittleworth, flood water could begin to approach properties Tuesday evening. Between Liss and Midhurst river levels are not currently expected to rise higher than they have been in recent days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have including in Lodsbridge and Fittleworth. This message will be updated by 21:00 on 08/12/2025.

River levels remain high due to recent rainfall, flooding may continue over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempstead, Minsterworth Ham and Quedgley. Severn Ham, Tewkesbury starts to fill. 

Predicted peaks:-  

Tuesday morning 09/12; Gloucester 2.9m to 3.2m at 00:00AM, Sandhurst 3.4m to 3.6m at 00:30AM. 
Tuesday afternoon 09/12; Gloucester 3.2 to 3.5m at 12:00PM, Sandhurst 3.6m to 3.8m at 12:30PM 

River levels are currently peaking and will remain high over the next few days. Additional rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  

This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 9 December 2025, or as the situation change.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. 

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Leadon. Locations that may be affected include Ledbury, Much Marcle, Staunton, Tibberton and Wedderburn Bridge may now be impassable. Water is over the road at Upleadon Court.  

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  

This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. 

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Avon from Abbotts Salford to Tewkesbury. Other locations that may be affected include Offenham, Evesham, Twyning and the Eckington Road. Mill Bank Road from Jubillee Bridge to Fladbury is impacted.  

Predicted peaks: -  

Bredon is currently peaking at 2.2m, 08/12/25. 

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  

This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels near Shermanbury are higher than normal, but now falling following Sunday's rain. Minor flooding affecting fields could continue through Monday. Light rain is forecast Monday afternoon. River levels are forecast to rise a minimal amount. More rain in the early hours of Tuesday will cause river levels to rise higher. Eventually beginning to fall near Shermanbury Tuesday evening. It is possible that river levels could rise to a similar height seen on Saturday, but probably not higher. We are closely monitoring the situation. Don't put yourself or others at risk. Avoid roads that flood, including the A281 at Mock Bridge. This message will be updated by 21:00 on 08/12/2025.

River levels along the Upper Ouse are higher than normal, but falling in all locations following Sunday's rain. Minimal impact flooding affecting fields, particularly near Barcombe Mills, could continue through Monday. Light rain is forecast Monday afternoon. River levels are forecast to rise a minimal amount. More rain in the early hours of Tuesday will cause river levels to rise higher. Eventually beginning to fall near Ardingly Tuesday evening, but not until Wednesday morning near Barcombe. It is possible that river levels could rise to a similar height seen on Saturday, but probably not higher. We are closely monitoring the situation and operating structures at Pimms Lock and Barcombe to reduce flood risk. Don't put yourself or others at risk. Avoid roads that flood, including Barcombe Mills Road. This message will be updated by 21:00 on 08/12/2025.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected. The river has peaked after last night's rainfall and is now receding. Further rainfall is forecast throughout Tuesday morning. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 08 December 2025 . More rain tonight may lead to another rise in river levels 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers around the River Rye and it's tributaries, including Ralsdale Beck, River Seph, Ledge Beck, Fangdale Beck, Prodale Beck, Ladhill Beck, Etton Gill, Borough Beck, Spittle Beck, including properties of Salton, Nunnington and Helmsley. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. 
This message will be updated by 1:15AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: River levels have fallen on most rivers in West Somerset, but remain high on the Washford River, which is still above the Flood Alert level. A band of heavy persistent rain is forecast from this evening, Monday 08 December 2025, through to about midday tomorrow, which will cause flooding impacts and sustain this Alert. The Washford River, and other rivers in the area. are forecast to rise. Flooding is possible on low lying land and roads near the Horner Water, River Aller, Washford River and the Hawkcombe, Monksilver and Doniford Streams and tributaries. Drier weather is forecast on Wednesday and Thursday. We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary. We are checking defences and clearing bridges, culverts and screens where necessary. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Keep checking for updates to these Alerts. This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 09 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
High tides today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 3:45 PM to 5:45 PM on 08/12/2025. 
The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.71 mAOD at 4:45 PM on 08/12/2025.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. Flooding of properties is not expected.

Astronomical tide levels are falling. The river flow at Teddington Weir is 107 cubic metres per second and is rising. We anticipate the flows to rise for the next 24 hours. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 6:00PM on 08 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Forecast levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river from around midnight on Monday evening through to Tuesday morning. The main areas of concern are Penzance, Newlyn, Crowlas, Porthleven, St Ives, Hayle, Camborne, Portreath and Perranporth.

We expect the river to remain high throughout the night though no flooding to properties is currently forecast. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Plymouth Sound, Wembury Bay and tidal estuaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides, strong winds and large waves tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible over high tides on the morning of Tuesday 9th December. 
Low lying coastal roads, promenades, car parks and harbours may be flooded. Areas at risk include Wembury, Noss Mayo, and Newton Ferrers. 

High tide at Plymouth on Tuesday morning is at 08:36, times of high water will vary along the coast.  Forecast total high tide levels is 2.23mAOD. Expect tide levels along the coast to be around 0.6m above tide table level. Strong force 8 Southerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 5m are forecast. 

The high tide of most concern is Tuesday morning and flood warnings are likely to be issued. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 11:30AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Low lying coastal roads, promenades, car parks and harbours may be flooded. Areas at risk include low lying areas in Fowey, Lostwithiel, Looe, Millendreath, and Seaton. 

High tide at Plymouth on Tuesday morning is 08:36, times of high water will vary along the coast.  Forecast total high tide levels is 2.23mAOD. Expect tide levels along the coast to be around 0.6m above tide table level. Strong force 8 Southerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 4.5m are forecast. 

High tide of concern is Tuesday morning and flood warnings are likely to be issued. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 11:30AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: High river levels tonight may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible today, Monday 8th December 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers Duddon, Crake, Mill Beck and other watercourses from Coniston to Barrow-in-Furness including low lying areas around Ulpha, Duddon Bridge, Broughton in Furness, Kirkby-in-Furness, Dalton in Furness and Ulverston. We are closely monitoring the situation. Don't put yourself or others at risk. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 5:00PM on Monday 08 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high due to recent rainfall. Further rainfall is forecast and the risk of flooding continues. Flooding is possible on 08 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Predicted Peaks:-  Cae Howel 4.2m to 4.5m 08/12 PM. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Severn estuary from Gloucester to Sharpness
items.message:
Higher than normal tides may lead to flooding over the next few days. 

Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the Estuary from Sandhurst to Chepstow and Sharpness over the coming days. Some lengths of the flood embankment at Longney and The Noards may be overtopped. Rodley Lane, Westbury and Awre Road, Brims Pill may be flooded.  

Predicted peaks: - 

Tuesday morning 09/12; Gloucester 2.9m to 3.2m at 00:00AM, Sandhurst 3.4m to 3.6m at 00:30AM. 
Tuesday afternoon 09/12; Gloucester 3.2 to 3.5m at 12:00PM, Sandhurst 3.6m to 3.8m at 12:30PM. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. Please continue to monitor local water levels and weather conditions.  

This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels tomorrow may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 09 December 2025 . 
Flooding may affect low lying land and roads along the River Wye from Hay on Wye to Ross on Wye. Other locations affected may include the A438 between Letton & Willersey, Byford, Bredwardine & Hereford. Road closures & diversions on the A438 may be in force. Predicted peaks:- Hay on Wye 3.1m to 3.5m on 09/12 PM, Bredwardine 5.1m to 5.5m on 09/12 PM, Belmont 5.1m to 5.5m on 10/12 AM, Old Wye Bridge 4.5m to 4.9m on 10/12 AM, Mordiford 4.7m to 5.1m on 10/12 AM, Ross on Wye 3.8m to 4.2m on 10/12 AM. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

The River Tone at Currymoor Pumping Station is still high. It is currently marginally below the Alert level (Hookbridge Spillway) due to the high tide sequence. A band of heavy persistent rain is forecast from this evening, Monday 08/12/2025, through to about midday tomorrow, which will cause further flooding impacts and sustain this Alert. The rain will cause rivers to rise again and bring fresh flows down into the Moors. Drier weather is forecast on Wednesday and Thursday. The current River Tone level at Currymoor pumping station is 7.31m and falling slowly. Water enters Currymoor via Hookbridge spillway if this level exceeds 7.45m. The current drain level at Currymoor pumping station is 4.65m and falling. Cutts Road floods if this level is above 5.75m, and New Road floods if it is above 6.18m. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. We are pumping when river levels allow. Take care and avoid driving through flood water. Refer to the local authority website for any local road closures. This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Wednesday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 10 December 2025 . 
Flooding may affect low lying land and roads along the River Wye. Predicted peaks:- Ross on Wye 3.8m to 4.2m 10/12 AM. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected. The river has peaked after last night's rainfall and is now receding. Further rainfall is forecast throughout Tuesday morning. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester
items.message:
Further rainfall is forecasted from midnight Tuesday, this will keep levels on the River Dee high. Levels will remain high today and into later this week. We are not expecting to reach Flood Warning levels. Townfield Lane is now impassable.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Dee. Flooding is possible at low lying land and roads around the River Dee at Shocklach, Farndon, Handley, Lower Kinnerton, Chester and Puddington.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 16:00PM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding.  

Flooding may affect low lying land & roads adjacent to the river from Highley to Tewkesbury; including Dog Lane Bewdley, Stourport, Diglis & Hylton Road towpath. Flooded drains affect the racecourse & Worcester CCG. PLP should be installed. New St Gate closed at Upton upon Severn. 

Predicted peaks:- 

Worcester is currently peaking at 3.5m, 08/12/25. 
Diglis is currently peaking at 3.3m, 08/12/25. 
Kempsey Yacht Club is currently peaking at 5.4m, 08/12/25. 
Saxons Lode is currently peaking at 4.1m, 08/12/25. 
Bewdley 3.0m to 3.4m on Tuesday, 09/12/25. 

Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .  

This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Flooding may affect low lying land and Squires Walk in the area of the Hatfield Brook Kempsey. Kempsey Flood Alleviation Scheme is operational.

Kempsey Yacht Club is currently peaking at 5.4m, 08/12/25.

items.description: River Severn at Sandhurst and Maisemore
items.message:
The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so.

Due to recent rainfall, river levels remain high but steady. Further rainfall is forecast early Tuesday morning. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Willington, Barrow upon Trent, Swarkestone, Bargate Lane and the access roads to Willington Meadows, the Twyford Village access road, Church Lane at Barrow, and Ingleby Lane. River levels at Willington Gauge and Shardlow Gauge will continue to remain high and rise over the next few days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 08 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

High tides on Tuesday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible for 1 hour either side of Tuesday's early morning tide and early afternoon tide. 
Tuesday's morning tide is at 01:30 and at 03:33. Storm Bram increases tide table values by 0.44 m. Total forecast tide is 3.74 metres Chart Datum (1.76 mAOD) at Lymington. Strong Southerly Force 5 wind. Tuesday's afternoon tide is at 13:34 and at 15:31 on 09/12/2025 is forecast to be 7 cm higher (1.83 mAOD). Strong Southerly Force 7 wind. Small amounts of water will flood the footpath near the Ship Inn pub at Town Quay. Saltgrass Lane will flood and be completely impassable to traffic. Property flooding is not expected. 
We are closing flood gates . 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . 
This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Wey, Preston Brook, River Jordan, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around the River Wey to Radipole Lake. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have and take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Ouse at York - riverside properties
items.message:
Rising river levels are expected to cause flooding today. 

Flooding is expected on 08 December 2025. 

Locations most affected will be properties on King's Staith in York and riverside areas through York from Lendal Bridge to Milennium Bridge. The Foss Barrier is operating and relevant flood gates in York have been closed. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 3:30PM on 08 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Clanfield Brook for Clanfield Village and the Shill Brook for Bampton
items.message:
Rising river levels may lead to flooding.

Flooding is possible from the morning of 08 Dec 2025.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible, especially in the Clanfield area. The weather forecast is for further rain over the next two days which could be heavy at times.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

This message will be updated by 19:00 on 08 Dec 2025 or as the situation changes.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . Monitor local water levels and weather conditions.

Water levels remain high and are expected to cause flooding. Flooding is expected today, Monday 8th December 2025. Locations most affected will be Keswick Campsite with flooding from the lake. This message will be updated by 5:00PM on Monday 8th December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels are causing flooding today. 
Flooding is expected on 08 December 2025 . More rain tonight may lead to another rise in river levels   
Locations most affected will be Buttercrambe Mill at Buttercrambe Bridge. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. 
Monitor local water levels and weather conditions and stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as sewage. 
This message will be updated by 1:15AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Derwent at Stamford Bridge - The Weir Caravan Park and Kexby Bridge

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire

items.message:
Rising river levels are expected to cause flooding today. 

Flooding is expected on 08 December 2025. 

Locations most affected will be riverside footpaths and low-lying land and property in Stamford Bridge, including the Weir Caravan Park. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 3:30PM on 08 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Forecast high river levels tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 09 December 2025 due to heavy rainfall this evening and overnight. 
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Corfe Stream, Swan Brook, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around the Corfe Castle and Swanage areas.  Flooding is possible in the early hours of Tuesday morning as river levels are expected to rise rapidly after forecast intense rainfall this evening, overnight and throughout Tuesday.  The forecast is expected to improve from Wednesday with little rainfall expected. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and clearing blockages from debris screens. 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 11:30AM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Minor Watercourses from Heighington to Dunston
items.message: High river levels today, Monday, may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 8th December 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Our forecasts indicate that flooding to properties is not likely and therefore flood warnings are not expected to be issued. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 11:00am on Tuesday, 9th December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Great Ouse from Brackley to Thornborough
items.message:
High river levels this morning may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible on 08 December 2025. 

Areas most at risk are those around the River Great Ouse from Brackley to Thornborough, including Padbury Brook. We are not expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. 

This message will be updated by 17:00 on 08 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Plymouth Sound, Wembury Bay and tidal estuaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High tides, strong winds and large waves are expected to cause flooding tomorrow morning.  
Flooding is expected over the morning high tide on Tuesday 9th December  
Spray and wave overtopping of quaysides, harbours and low lying areas is expected to flood properties. Areas at risk include Kingsand, Cawsand and Plymouth Hoe. High tide at Plymouth on Tuesday morning is at 08:36, times of high water will vary along the coast. The forecast total high tide level is 2.23mAOD. Expect tide levels along the coast to be around 0.6m above tide table level. Strong force 8 southerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 4.5m are forecast.  
We are closely monitoring the situation .  
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded .  
This message will be updated by 1:30PM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: South Hayling and South Eastoke seafront
items.message:
High tides are expected to cause flooding today. 
Flooding is expected for 2 hours either side of Monday afternoon's tide at 13:21 on 08/12/2025.   
The weather increases tide table values by 0.2 m. The total forecast tide is 4.97 metres Chart Datum (2.24 mAOD) at Portsmouth. Strong South Westerly Force 5 wind. It is possible there will be water in the prom at high tide in the Eastoke Corner area. Local teams are monitoring the beach condition at Eastoke for any further actions. Tuesday’s tide at 02:09 on 09/12/2025 is forecast to be 13 cm higher (2.37 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Activate any flood protection products you may have . Avoid South Hayling seafront. Shingle can be thrown by wind and waves. 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 08 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, Yeovilton to Huish Episcopi
items.message: Levels remain high on the River Yeo following the rain over the weekend. While levels have dropped further up in the Pen Mill and Ilchester areas, river and drain levels are still high in the lowland areas around Long Load and Huish Episcopi. Floodwater remains in the Moors, such as around Long Load, Wet Moor and Huish Episcopi. A band of heavy persistent rain is forecast from this evening, Monday 08 December 2025, through to about midday tomorrow, which will cause further flooding impacts and sustain this Alert. This will cause rivers in the upper catchments to rise again and bring fresh flows down the River Yeo and into the Moors. Drier weather is forecast on Wednesday and Thursday. We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary. We are checking defences, bridges, culverts and screens. We will pump when river levels allow. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Act on your flood plan if you haven't already. This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, The Levels

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Parrett, Kings Sedgemoor Drain, River Sowy

items.message: Levels remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett following the weekend's rain. While levels have dropped further up at Pen Mill and Chiselborough, river and drain levels are still high in the lowland areas around Huish Episcopi, Langport, the River Sowy and King's Sedgemoor. A band of heavy persistent rain is forecast from this evening, Monday 08/12/2025, through to about midday tomorrow, which will cause further flooding impacts and sustain this Alert. This will cause rivers to rise again and bring fresh flows down into the Moors. Drier weather is forecast on Wednesday and Thursday. Flooding will affect areas near the Rivers Yeo, Parrett, Kings Sedgemoor Drain and Sowy, with low lying land and roads most affected, including Westover Trading Estate at Langport. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. We are checking defences, bridges, culverts and screens. We will pump when river levels allow. Take care and avoid driving through flood water. Act on your flood plan if you haven't already. This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 09 December 2025 or as the situation changes.
